org.gerstner.oauth2android.common
Class Connection

java.lang.Object
  org.gerstner.oauth2android.common.Connection

public class Connection
extends java.lang.Object

The Connection class contains static methods used to connect to any url given. In addition to the methods it holds predefined values that can be used to identify the http-method in a standardized way.

Author:
Christoph Gerstner

Field Summary
static java.lang.String HTTP_METHOD_DELETE
          As the name already suggests, this method does not send any resources to the server but makes the explicit request to delete the resource (and make implied changes) the request is leading to.
static java.lang.String HTTP_METHOD_GET
          This http method should only be used to retrieve informations from the server.
static java.lang.String HTTP_METHOD_POST
          This http methd can be used to transfer a resource or its modifications to the server.
static java.lang.String HTTP_METHOD_PUT
          Usually this method is used when the client sends a resource (included in the http body entity) to the server to place this resource under the specified url.

Field Detail

HTTP_METHOD_PUT

public static final java.lang.String HTTP_METHOD_PUT
Usually this method is used when the client sends a resource (included in the http body entity) to the server to place this resource under the specified url.

See Also:
HTTP_METHOD_POST, HTTP_METHOD_GET, HTTP_METHOD_DELETE, Constant Field Values

HTTP_METHOD_POST

public static final java.lang.String HTTP_METHOD_POST
This http methd can be used to transfer a resource or its modifications to the server. When using this method the client agrees to implicit changes on the server side.

See Also:
HTTP_METHOD_PUT, HTTP_METHOD_GET, HTTP_METHOD_DELETE, Constant Field Values

HTTP_METHOD_GET

public static final java.lang.String HTTP_METHOD_GET
This http method should only be used to retrieve informations from the server. A client that uses this method does not automatically agree to making changes on the server side.

See Also:
HTTP_METHOD_PUT, HTTP_METHOD_POST, HTTP_METHOD_DELETE, Constant Field Values

HTTP_METHOD_DELETE

public static final java.lang.String HTTP_METHOD_DELETE
As the name already suggests, this method does not send any resources to the server but makes the explicit request to delete the resource (and make implied changes) the request is leading to.

See Also:
HTTP_METHOD_PUT, HTTP_METHOD_POST, HTTP_METHOD_GET, Constant Field Values

httpPostRequest

public static Response httpPostRequest(java.util.List<NameValuePair> parameterList,
                                       java.lang.String url)
                                throws InvalidRequestException,
                                       InvalidClientException,
                                       InvalidGrantException,
                                       UnauthorizedClientException,
                                       UnsupportedGrantTypeException,
                                       InvalidScopeException,
                                       OAuthException,
                                       java.io.IOException
TODO: more javaDoc
Makes a standard http post request. The list of NameValuePairs can contain all parameters and parameter designations for the request.
